definition: to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department

sentences.english: She was enjoined to live more frugally.
sentences.chinese: 她被責成更儉省地生活。
他甚至必需品也要儉省。

sentences.english: Memories of hard years made the old woman excessively thrifty.
sentences.chinese: 早年艱苦生活的回憶使這個老婦人極度儉省。

sentences.english: You Do not suspicious, he is accustomed to the parsimonious .
sentences.chinese: 你別多心，他就是儉省慣了的。

sentences.english: What's more, they can save money for other purposes.
sentences.chinese: 更主要地是，他們能夠儉省地錢用於其他目標。

sentences.english: Everyone calls him tight-fisted,but I see he is just thrifty.
sentences.chinese: 人人說他小氣，可我看他不過是儉省。

sentences.english: The flat storage is a great space saver in the freezer and simplifies thawing.
sentences.chinese: 平放能夠儉省冷凍室的空間並且簡化了消融。
